alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:28PM EDT until August 10 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Pike. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkhorn City, Belcher, Cedarville, Marrowbone, Rockhouse, Ashcamp, Lookout, Mouthcard, Toonerville and Shelby Gap. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
